rule: The chatbot output must continue with "People names:" followed by a comma-separated list of people names extracted from the provided text.
input: Text: Alphabet Inc.'s research project was presented by Sergey Brin, raising important questions.
validityText:
The given input is a block of text, which aligns with the primary requirement of the input specification that states "The input is a block of text." The text mentions "Alphabet Inc." which is the name of a company, in accordance with the specification's allowance for mentioning company names. It also includes the name "Sergey Brin," which addresses the part of the specification that permits the mention of names of people. Furthermore, the text introduces a specific topic, "research project," and hints at broader discussion with "raising important questions," thereby fulfilling the specification's provision for including specific topics and general themes. The text is clear, concise, and in an understandable format, adhering to the requirement of being human-readable and articulated in an understandable language. There are no omissions or sections that make the text incomplete in conveying relevant entities according to the input specification.

No violation.
OK
